titleStmt.title: An anker of Christian doctrine Whearein the most principal pointes of Catholique religion are proued by the only written word of God. Not abandoning diuine, nor apostolical traditions, authentical councels, popes decrees, auncient fathers, nor other ordinary proofes: but abstracting from them in this encounter: for better satisfaction of those, who wil admitte none other tryal of true religion, but Scriptures only. Permissu superiorum.
Anker of Christian doctrine. Part 1
titleStmt.author: Worthington, Thomas, 1549-1627.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Thomas Kellam [i.e. the Birchley Hall press?],

notesStmt.note: Preface signed: Th. W., i.e. Thomas Worthington.
The imprint is false. Possibly printed at the Birchley Hall press in Lancashire (STC).
Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
